intro: Perebea guianensis subsp. castilloides, commonly known as the Guianese perebea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
